dt: {bc}the main stem of a tree apart from limbs and roots
{bc}the human or animal body apart from the head, neck, and appendages {bc}{sx|torso||}
{bc}the shaft of a column or pilaster
{bc}a large rigid piece of luggage used usually for transporting clothing and personal effects
{bc}a superstructure over a ship's hatches usually level with the poop deck
{bc}the part of the cabin of a boat projecting above the deck
{bc}the housing for a centerboard or rudder
{bc}the long muscular proboscis of the elephant
{bc}a usually major channel or passage (such as a chute or shaft)
{bc}a circuit between two telephone exchanges for making connections between subscribers
{bc}a usually electronic path over which information is transmitted (as between computer systems)
{bc}the principal channel or main body of a system or part that divides into branches

et: Middle English {it}trunke{/it} Anglo-French {it}trunc, trunke{/it}, from Latin {it}truncus{/it} trunk, torso
shortdef: the main stem of a tree apart from limbs and roots —called also bole
the human or animal body apart from the head, neck, and appendages : torso
